result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrell Demound Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run-Involve Death, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
07-28-2016: Corrected JOC rest amount ($1,000) 
$386.00 to Omar A.; and $1,000.00 to Milwaukee County Burial Assistance.

Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges.  
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL MONETARY AMOUNTS:  DOC to collect amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.  Balance as a condition of Extended Supervision.  To be paid by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

superMiscConds.notes: No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a bioligical specimen for DNA analysis.
Court advised defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrell Demound Jones

records.descr: Petition for sentence adjust denied-public interst

records.addlTxt: Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Hon. Janet C. Protasiewicz, Br. 24, calendar successor, for review. mag

Terrell Jones #497280, Sanger Powers Correctional Center, N8375 County Line Road U
Oneida, WI  54155.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original GUILTY PLEA Transcript (9 pages) commencing JUNE 18, 2015 received and filed. kl

reflects correction: entered restitution amount as $1,000.00 (not $100.00) 
updated 5% and 10% surcharges on JOC and assessment reports - copies to DOC
Certification of SENTENCING transcript commencing JULY 14, 2015,  received and filed. (33 Pages)  Copy of transcript forwarded to:  REQUIRED BY STATUTE
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Terrell Demound Jones in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Terrell Demound Jones in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel and defendant. COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 8 years with 111 days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 5 years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 3 years; pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection; pay restitution of $386 to Omar A. and $1,000 to Milwaukee County Burial Assistance by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection. .  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) seek and maintain employment.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis;
- defendant's motor vehicle operating privileges are revoked for 5 years; 
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.
Victim/Witness Impact Statement received and filed./ds

Defendant Terrell Demound Jones in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Terrell Demound Jones in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Branch 38 heard case for branch 44 for purposes of plea only.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   Parties waive PSI. Court orders defendant remanded to the Sheriff's department. Case adjourned for sentencing in Br. 44.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case transferred to br. 38, Judge Wagner for change of plea./ds
Crime Victim Impact Statement received and filed./ds

Attorney Robert Lee Taylor in court, defendant Terrell Demound Jones not in court, in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Robert Lee Taylor in court, defendant Terrell Demound Jones not in court, in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense has received discovery.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrell Demound Jones in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Terrell Demound Jones in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State's demand for discovery and inspection received and filed. tk
State's Proposed Jury Instructions with attached substantive instructions and proposed verdict forms, received and filed. tk
State's Motion in Limine received and filed. tk
State's Witness List received and filed. TK

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Terrell Demound Jones in court with attorney Joan E. Zawikowski.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
